    .arguments_check

    internal_function_backbone.Rd

    Check if 1) the types of input are correct and 2) an input is missed.

    Usage

    .arguments_check(x, na.rm, finite, external.function.name)

    Arguments

    x

    Numeric or logical vector or matrix or numeric table where find the initial values to calculate.

    na.rm

    Single logical value. Should missing values (NA and NaN) be removed ?

    finite

    Single logical value. Should infinite values (Inf and -Inf) be removed ? Warning: this argument does not remove NA and NaN. Please use the na.rm argument.

    external.function.name

    Name of the function using the .arguments_check() function.

    Value

    An error message if the type of input is not correct, or input missed, nothing otherwise.

    Details

    WARNING

    arguments of the .arguments_check() function are not checked, so use carefully inside other functions

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# Example that shouldn't be run because this is an internal function
.arguments_check(x = 1:3, na.rm = TRUE)

.arguments_check(x = c(Inf, NA), na.rm = TRUE, finite = TRUE)
}
